etymology.description: Depicts a cowry shell, which was used as currency in ancient China.
etymology.interpretation: The character 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") visually represents a cowry shell, a valuable item used in trade and as currency in ancient Chinese societies.
etymology.simplification: 贝(貝) is the simplified form, derived from a cursive script version of 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry"), maintaining the visual representation while making the character faster to write.

examples.chinese: 古代人用貝(古代人用貝)作为货币(作為貨幣)，也用来装饰(也用來裝飾)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài rén yòng bèi zuòwéi huòbì, yě yòng lái zhuāngshì.
examples.english: Ancient people used cowrie shells as currency and also for decoration.

examples.chinese: 一些古文献记载了貝(一些古文獻記載了貝)的神秘价值(的神秘價值)，激发了人们对古代文化的兴趣(激發了人們對古代文化的興趣)。
examples.pinyin: Yīxiē gǔ wénxiàn jìzǎi le bèi de shénmì jiàzhí, jīfā le rénmen duì gǔdài wénhuà de xìngqù.
examples.english: Some ancient texts recorded the mysterious value of cowrie shells, sparking people’s interest in ancient culture.

examples.chinese: 海边曾有传说(海邊曾有傳說)，珊瑚和貝点缀着沙滩的美丽(珊瑚和貝點綴著沙灘的美麗)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎibiān céng yǒu chuánshuō, shānhú hé bèi diǎnzuì zhe shātān de měilì.
examples.english: There was a legend by the seaside that corals and cowrie shells adorned the beauty of the beach.
